poem:
"The Weasel of Wealth"

In the French morning,
a likeness formed of mirrors
and red labor,
whispers through the factory gates.

Calamy, like the plums,
temptingly sweet and treacherous,
weaves into the tapestry of wealth,
a thread spun from scheming intrigue.

In this precise panorama,
each act is as calculated as the next,
a dance on the knife-edge of hilarity—
ripe and questionable as yesterday's fruit.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Origin of Evil review – classy comedy-thriller with shades of Succession and Knives Out Succession meets Knives Out in this comedy-thriller directed by Sébastien Marnier in what is an extremely French comic style: tongue-in-cheek, a little frothy, tiptoeing close to camp. It stars Call My Agent’s brilliant Laure Calamy as a scheming factory worker who wheedles her way into a dysfunctional mega-rich family. Calamy is often cast as likable, relatable women but here she". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
